body:
Use Cases

Website campaigns drive clicks back to your website or conversions. Uses for this highly targeted ad unit include:

  • Targeting visitors who have browsed your site for specific products, increasing the chances of turning that visitor into a customer.
  • Targeting consumers who recently purchased a product or service from you to promote your latest deals and offers.

Facebook ads combine the power of retargeting with social capabilities such as likes, shares, or comments, to increase organic interest as well.

Technical Requirements

File format: JPEG, GIF (static), PNG

File size: 1MB maximum

Image dimensions: 600x315

20% Text Limit: Facebook notesthat images with minimal text are more engaging. Limit any text to 20% of the image surface. Want to double check? Inspect your image with Facebook's Grid Tool.

Message (optional): 500 characters, recommended max

Title (required): 25 characters, including spaces

Body Text (required): 90 characters, including spaces

Destination URL: Website URL

How do I set up a Website Campaign on Facebook?

Setting up a Website Campaign on Facebook is easy, even if you do not already have ads prepared!

Click to website campaign launch guide

1. Log in to AdRoll and click “Create a New Campaign” in the right sidebar.

2. Click "Get Started" on a Facebook campaign.


3. Campaign Settings: Name your campaign, set a weekly budget and specify a Campaign Objective:

  • We recommend defining a conversion before your launch your campaign so we can set it up to optimize for conversions with a"Website Conversions" goal.
  • If you do not have a conversion segment defined, we'll optimize towards clicks instead with a "Clicks to Website" goal.

Or if you do not have a conversion segment:


4. Target Visitors: Choose the audience you wish to target. You can select "Create New" to create new audience segments or "Choose Existing" to use a segment you previously created.

5a. Add Ads & Select Placement: Select your desired Facebook placements. We recommend keeping all three checked to maximize re-engagement.

5b. Add Ads & Select Placement: Add Ads.

  • If you already have ads, Select "Upload New" to create a new ad or "Choose Existing to upload from your Ad Library. Click here for guidelines on creating your ad(s).
  • If you need ads, "Request Free Ads" from our Design Squad.

6. Review & Finish: Review your campaign details and hit Launch! Your campaign will be reviewed within one business day.
